description: {"blocks":[{"key":"68gl9","text":"Step-by-step protocol for performing HyDrop-RNA. The duration of each step assumes an experienced protocol user. For a first-time user, we recommend doubling the expected time for each step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1mfh","text":"Setting up the Microfluidic Framework","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5b9od","text":"These steps need to happen in advance before the run can be started, as time between the preparation of the cell  resuspension in RT mix and actual encapsulation needs to be minimised to preserve cell viability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnfkc","text":"Boot up Droplet Genomics onyx.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a08gr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7km46","text":"Check syringe diameters in Onyx program. Any deviations from the true syringe diameter will result in biased flow rates, as the pump converts imposed flow rates to linear motion of the syringe plunger.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4pigd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4p5me","text":"Connect laptop or tablet to Onyx","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u0oe","text":"Fill two 3 mL syringes with ~1 mL fresh mineral oil each using a 1 mL pipette. Connect a needle after the syringes are filled. Do not fill the syringes by aspirating mineral oil through a pipette as this technique can introduce unwanted air bubbles. Moreover, mineral oil on the syringe needle will complicate connecting the tubing. Tap the syringe  so that bubbles rise to the top, then push all air out. The syringe should be free of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6t2t9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dvilb","text":"Connect a ~15 cm piece of 1 mm inner diameter tubing to each syringe. The tubing should be long enough to comfortably reach from the syringe when it is in position to the inlet of the microfluidic chip. If the tubing is too long, it may get in the way during operation. If the tubing is too short, it may tear or come undone when you move the microfluidic chip around.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"272kp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fkk2c","text":"Using a 6 mm and 1 mm biopsy needle, punch out a small donut-shaped plug out of a ~1 cm thick PDMS slab. The outer diameter should snugly fit into the filterless pipette tip, and the inner diameter should firmly accomodate the microfluidic tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"uphu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7jenr","text":"Connect the syringe's tubing to the pipette tip through the PDMS plug. Now,  mineral oil out of the syringe into the tubing until the micropipette tip is completely filled. Then, fix the syringes in the DG Onyx pump system, including the aspiration clamps. These syringes are now ready to aspirate the beads and cell sample respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4p4c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d6ejk","text":"Later on, we will aspirate the cell and bead mix into the micropipette tip (NOT into the syringe, if we were to aspirate into the syringe, we would have too much dead volume in the tubing). When fixing the syringes to the DG Onyx pumps, some liquid may be pushed out or sucked in. This is normal and can be corrected later","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":322}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"of7d","text":"Fill a 3 mL syringe with ~1.5 mL of RAN Biotech emulsion oil using a pipette tip, connect a needle and a piece of 1 mm tubing. Push the carrier oil all the way to the end of the tubing, and insert the syringe into the DG Onyx pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqo62","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3vccs","text":"When fixing the syringes to the DG Onyx pumps, some liquid may be pushed out or sucked in. This is normal and can be corrected later","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":132}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41k5q","text":"Take a HyDrop High Aspect 65/80 microfluidic chip and inspect each channel under a microscope for defects or dust. Fix the chip to the moving platform above the DG Onyx microscope using the chip holder. Make sure that at least 3 sets of channels are available for the run in case an error occurs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bel21","text":"Connect a short piece of tubing to the outlet. Then, take a DNA lo-bind 1.5 mL eppendorf, put it in a tube rack, and position it on top of the microscope platform. Put the outlet tube into the Eppendorf. This first outlet tube will be a \"waste\" tube used to collect the outlet until a stable emulsion is formed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3an1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe2a7","text":"Keep 200 uL PCR strip tubes ready to collect samples in. Each tube will contain 50 uL of emulsion after the run ends.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f6v6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"59hs1","text":"Don't take a piece of tubing that is too long. This leads to a time delay between the end of the chip and the end of the outlet tube. Every now and then, during the run, you want to sample the droplets by touching a microscopy slide with the end of the tube and inspecting the droplets under the microscope. If you change flow parameters during the run, you want to be able to inspect the new droplet sizes and bead loading ASAP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":429}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42qdo","text":"A finished set-up look should like so:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pqn1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ns0i","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"hirk","text":"Note that we use a cover from a pipette tip box as a seating for the samples. For longer runs (10 minutes or more), we recommend that you use a small ice box or cold block to seat the samples as they are produced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a70k6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7kmoh","text":"The plugged-in chip should look like so:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ubof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75pr2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"49cs","text":"In this orientation, from north to south, you have the cell mixture, the oil, the outlet tube and finally the beads at the bottom. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2832DA29345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Onyx-2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk59bkfqp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk57bkfqp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gk58bkfqp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk56bkfqp.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2832DB8D345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":247,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"20210514_145257.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk6dbkfqp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk6bbkfqp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gk6cbkfqp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gk6abkfqp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40nvl","text":"Preparing the reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5iv5j","text":"Now, we will prepare beads, cells and RT mix, which will then be aspirated into the microfluidic tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ig0","text":"Prepare a fresh volume of Bead Lysis Buffer (BLB):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fuo2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6h9ae","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8v7ta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c96ls","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo30r","text":"Take a fresh aliquot of frozen HyDrop-RNA beads from the -80 C stock, thaw at room temperature for ~1 minute. Transfer the beads to a 1 mL tube. Rinse the bead stock aliquot tube using bead lysis buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ccmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqm3d","text":"Wash the beads by resuspending them in BLB, centrifuging at 1000 xg for 1 minute, taking the supernatant and resuspending them again in BLB. Perform this step a total of three times. After the last wash, take as much supernatant as possible without aspirating any beads. The best way to do this is to remove most of the BLB using a 1 mL pipette, re-centrifuging, and then using a 200 and 10 uL pipette to remove the rest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dcdpd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"asle0","text":"Keep the beads on ice until you need them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bcpo4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5n0ek","text":"If you do not remove all of the supernatant BLB, the beads will be sparse during the first stage of your HyDrop run, resulting in a loss of cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":146}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_8":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_9":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_10":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"F_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,100,100],"data":[["BLB","Stock","Volume (uL)","Final","Final in drop ","Unit"],["Tris-HCl (pH 7)","1000","625","125","25","mM"],["NaCl","5000","150","150","30","mM"],["MgCl2","1000","62.5","12.5","2.5","mM"],["Tween-20","100","200","4","0.80","%"],["TX-100","10","375","0.75","0.15","%"],["Glycerol","100","1250","25","5.00","%"],["BSA","10","500","1","0.20","%"],["dH2O","-","1837.5","","",""],["","Total","5000","","","\u0000"]],"guid":"58C91A10BCE111EB9636E5F2295B4B9F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["BLB","Stock","Volume (uL)","Final","Final in drop ","Unit"],["Tris-HCl (pH 7)","1000","625","125","25","mM"],["NaCl","5000","150","150","30","mM"],["MgCl2","1000","62.5","12.5","2.5","mM"],["Tween-20","100","200","4","0.80","%"],["TX-100","10","375","0.75","0.15","%"],["Glycerol","100","1250","25","5.00","%"],["BSA","10","500","1","0.20","%"],["dH2O","-","1837.5","","",""],["","Total","5000","","","\u0000"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b78fd","text":"Load the beads into the correct mineral-oil filled pipette tip in the single-cell room as described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"238g1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1msjl","text":"Take the mineral oil-filled pipette tip destined for beads and make sure no large air bubbles are present.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2jhba","text":"Prime the mineral oil all the way to the very end of the tip using a flow of 10 000 uL/hour","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bohl3","text":"Put the micropipette tip into the eppendorf with the centrifuged beads","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16k32","text":"At a rate of 5000 to 10 000 ul/hour, ASPIRATE the beads into the tube. If you blow in air bubbles by accident, centrifuge and resuspend again.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9h017","text":"Stop aspirating beads into the tube once air bubbles are formed. If you do it right, only a small amount of beads should be left at the bottom of the tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35cla","text":"Remove any air and prime the pumps by dispensing at 5000 uL/h until no air is left in the micropipette tip.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6hcsv","text":"Plug the pipette tip into the designated bead inlet.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9r3rm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqro6","text":"Any large air bubbles in the bead stock should rise to the interface between water and mineral oil. This is not a problem if the bubbles are small.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1g6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7m1qv","text":"It is best to do this before preparing the cells in order to save time later on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":80}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cv9f","text":"Prepare a single-cell suspension according to the appropriate protocol for your sample. Resuspend the cells in 0.04% to 1% BSA in PBS. Be sure to filter the cells to remove cell clumps. Generally it is best to use the lowest concentration of BSA that will prevent clumping of your cells. Concentrations higher than 1% may lead to aggregation nof BSA with other reagents within the RT mix, leading to blockage of the microfluidic channels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"31gtr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"avm65","text":"Aim for a cell concentration of at least 1 M/mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91uo4","text":"The following step is crucial for cell recovery. Here, we want to resuspend a number of cells equal to ~1.5x the number of cells you ultimately want to recover in the data into the RT mix. However, the volumetric space that we have reserved for cells suspension is limited. In this example case, for a total volume of 170 uL of RT mix, we reserve 31 uL for cell suspension/water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ffane","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"84q4h","text":"For example, if you want to recover 14 000 cells, you would want to take a volume of single-cell suspension containing 21000 cells. If your single cell suspension has a concentration of 1 M/mL, you would need 21 uL of your cell suspension. You would add 139 ul of RT pre-Mix (RT mix without any water or cell suspension) to your 21 uL of cell pellet and top off to 170 uL using 10 uL of water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"689r1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bulu2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"169dd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64cqk","text":"Proceed to HyDrop run immediately with the cells kept on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_10":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_11":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_12":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_13":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_8":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_9":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_13":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"F_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"centrifuge":"300","colTitles":["","","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,100,100],"data":[["RT {"blocks":[{"key":"77id5","text":"HyDrop Run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i0ve","text":"Now, we will proceed to the actual HyDrop run. Before proceeding, make sure that the following steps are ready:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"r8b6","text":"Outlet connected to waste","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"digqt","text":"Beads loaded into micropipette tip, and connected to chip","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"67q28","text":"Microscope and pumps ready to go","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4e3ha","text":"PCR machine available for RT","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fdeg","text":"Load the cells as follows (identical to bead loading):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dpf6l","text":"Take the mineral oil-filled pipette tip destined for RT mix and make sure no large air bubbles are present.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43jaf","text":"Prime the mineral oil all the way to the very end of the tip using a flow of 10 000 uL/hour","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"77omf","text":"Put the micropipette tip into the eppendorf with the centrifuged beads","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gsou","text":"At a rate of 5000 to 10 000 ul/hour, ASPIRATE the RT mix into the tube. If you blow in air bubbles by accident, centrifuge and resuspend again.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"famje","text":"Stop aspirating beads into the tube once air bubbles are formed. If you do it right, only a small amount of RT mix should be left at the bottom of the tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7mora","text":"Remove any air and prime the pumps by dispensing at 5000 uL/h until no air is left in the micropipette tip.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cuf3e","text":"Plug the pipette tip into the designated inlet.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6l7hq","text":"Start the HyDrop run by priming all flows as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ckdf4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8hbio","text":"Cells: 200 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7340g","text":"Beads: 200 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"amn07","text":"Oil: 100 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cd5tj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d44f0","text":"Oil will show up first, as it is least viscous. When it does, reduce the oil flow to 50.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3trd3","text":"Next, RT mix will show up. Put RT mix to 50 uL in order to not lose any sample while the beads are priming into the microfluidic chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9v06c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"alemi","text":"Once all three flows have reached the flow focusing point, increase the flow rates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"51gj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"euiln","text":"Cells: 600 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8c3n5","text":"Beads; 150 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f52bi","text":"Oil: 950 ul/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8p6k5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1jhe0","text":"It is always up to the user to adjust the flow rates as necessary. When droplets are too large, either decrease cell and bead flow, or increase oil flow. When the total flow of the system is too high, delamination of the PDMS chip from the glass may occur.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":256}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etpii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6sma7","text":"Now, when the droplet formation is stable, be ready to change the waste collection Eppendorf tube to the actual sample collection Eppendorf tubes. Put 50 uL total of emulsion into each 200 uL PCR tube. This can be calculated as follows, assuming you use flows as we describe above:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ajgms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8b4f8","text":"Cell/RT flow + bead flow = 600 uL/h + 150 uL/h = 750 uL/h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bnd1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"512qd","text":"The cell/RT flow fraction = 600 uL/h / 750 uL/h = 0.8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8hnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ft64b","text":"We can read the volume that a specific channel has pumped through on the DG Onyx control screen. We desire a total volume of 50 uL, thus:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9o28n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rven","text":"The volume of cell/RT in 50 uL of emulsion = 0.8 * 50 uL = 40 uL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"823dp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fhtb","text":"Thus, we monitor the cell/RT flow volume, and every time 40 uL has been dispensed, we switch the outlet to a new 200 uL PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ncc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"48a60","text":"Alternatively, you can collect everything into a 1.5 mL eppendorf tube, and aliquot your desired volumes to your PCR tubes. We try to avoid it as it may lead to merging droplets if you are not careful. Additionally, you will lose some of the emulsion to your pipetting as well as to the original 1.5 mL eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fn0ph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7g662","text":"The run ends when the RT mix runs out. When this happens, you will see a change from aqeous RT mix to viscous mineral oil in the flow focus. Unplug the sample outlet tube and let the remains flow into the sample collection tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h6m2","text":"Reverse Transcription","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5k5e7","text":"Transfer the emulsions to a PCR block for the following program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dg9tf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2e1ee","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"acpv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6lk1","text":"While RT is on, you can prepare GITC buffer and other components necessary in the later steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[50,50,100],"data":[["RT Program","",""],["42 C","90 min",""],["Cycle:","","|"],["50 C","2 min","x11"],["42 C","2 min","|"],["85 C","5 min",""],["4 C","inf",""]],"guid":"7EE5C2207A8011E98C9407F63EF118F7","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dr2u2","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"printData":[["RT Program","",""],["42 C","90 min",""],["Cycle:","","|"],["50 C","2 min","x11"],["42 C","2 min","|"],["85 C","5 min",""],["4 C","inf",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7g41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96qhk","text":"Droplet Breaking and Purification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7sagn","text":"Now, we will break all the droplets and purify the cDNA, which is the result of our in-droplet reverse transcription reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60j2b","text":"Remove the bottom oil phase without disturbing the emulsion. It is not harmful to leave ~10 uL of oil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uoar","text":"Add 55 uL of the GITC Buffer and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4216k","text":"Add 5 mL of 1M DTT\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct3l5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0191","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rdda","text":"Add 125 ul of droplet breaking solution (20% PFO in HFE) to each sample. {"blocks":[{"key":"c3uk9","text":"NEB Ultra Library Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"btjhd","text":"Here, we will follow a slightly modified NEB Ultra II protocol for samples of  \u003c= 100 ng of cDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
